channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2023100921
item.description:
Report E-2023100921

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a weeping weld 1 cup of material has been released onto the concrete floor, a contractor was required for the transfer of the product. It was determined that the tote could not be repaired and the product will need to be transferred. There was 350 Gallons of product in the leaking tote. All impacted surfaces were wiped down with water and the 1 cup of material released was absorbed into pads and containerized. The material remaining in the damaged tote was transferred to two new totes and they will continue to the destination. Terminal staff advised that the leaking steel tote will be returned to the shipper. (1) 5G DF - Impacted pads was created for waste and was left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100910
item.description:
Report E-2023100910

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 18, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN1263 was discovered to have a leaking patched and released approximately five (5) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. The crews deployed granular absorbents to the released material and swept them in using hand tools. E3 personnel containerized all UN1263-impacted absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon drum for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100868
item.description:
Report E-2023100868

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 -3 ounces of Axalta RCS29892 DR200KG HAPS Resin Solution was released from (1) 55-gallon DM due to improper packaging. The release impacted the inside of the trailer. It was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 85 gallon DM containing (1) 55-gallon DM of product that was overpacked. Waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100792
item.description:
Report E-2023100792

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: PASADENA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stated he went into the store to obtain a veeder reading. Driver did state, the load amount was 3000 gallons per delmo but dialed it back. Driver stated at first, he didn’t stick diesel tank but stuck the gas drop. Then he mentioned stick was broke and couldn’t get an accurate amount in diesel tank and mentioned he did stick the tank. Driver states he started dropping diesel and then hooked up Unleaded and started to drop it also. Driver observed diesel not flowing and started gas while trying to figure out problem with diesel. Driver had to stop diesel flow several times to allow tank to breathe and lifted drop gun off fitting in ground allowing it to drain down. Driver completed unleaded drop and was clearing hose when he seen product coming from drop. Driver cleaned up with spill pads. Driver reported to store but left scene with cones around spill to later return and put down oil dry to finish cleanup.

item.title: Report E-2023100752
item.description:
Report E-2023100752

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSX experienced a UN2810 "07347A Durez Liquid One Step Phenolic Resin" release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of material released to a 6’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor due to the pallet collapsing. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. They were then collected into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

DescribePack: WHEN OPENED, 3 PLASTIC CONTAINERS OF LIQUID WERE INSIDE AND THERE WAS ROOM FOR 4. 4 WERE ALSO INDICATED ON INVOICE. NONE OF THE 3 CONTAINERS PRESENT HAD LOOSE CAPS OR WERE ACTIVELY LEAKING BUT LIQUID WAS SEEN ON THE OUTSIDE OF ONE CONTAINER. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS PLACED IN A DRUM FOR INSPECTION BUT WAS NOT LEAKING WHEN FOUND.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Liquid line valve was found leaking from the liquid valve plug. The valve was defective and the plug was loose, BNSF responders tighten the plug to stop the leak.

item.title: Report I-2023080017
item.description:
Report I-2023080017

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: ROBSTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERIGAS EAGLE PROPANE L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AmeriGas vehicle traveling northbound on Hwy 77 at posted speed. Third party vehicle rear ended AmeriGas vehicle causing third party vehicle to be totaled. Due to impact, AmeriGas rear deck piping ripped or torn causing release of propane. Responding HazMat team was able to make safe releasing product and vehicles were towed from scene.
